snippet.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's most outrageous allegations from trial
snippet.description: Actor Johnny Depp and actress ex-wife Amber Heard saw their time in court come to a close today.   The three-week libel case was brought to court by Depp, 57, who's suing the publishers of The Sun newspaper after it published an article last year dubbing the Pirates of the Caribbean star a "wife-beater" in its headline – which Depp heavily denies.  Magic Mike star Heard, 34, said today that she "travelled here to the UK to testify as a witness to assist the court" but did not file the lawsuit and would have "preferred not to be here in court" however, she said she wanted to be a witness for the publication.  After 15 days of the trial – and it expected to take the judge months to come to a verdict - many bizarre, horrifying and bold allegations were made throughout the trial from both parties.  Daily Star Online has taken a look back at the most outrageous allegations made by both Depp and Heard.  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles  Johnny Depp   Depp made many allegations against his ex-wife Heard throughout the lengthy trial, as did she, but the pair also freely confessed to a few bizarre claims.  From claiming he's a victim of an "elaborate hoax", saying Heard "manipulated photos" to confessing he called her "Amber Turd" after a row, the court heard many claims.  The actor's security guard also claimed that he saw Heard punch the actor "with a closed fist" and spat on him during an explosive row.  Heard 'spat on and punched Depp in eye', court heard   Depp's security guard of seven years Travis McGivern claimed he saw Heard be physically violent towards the Hollywood actor.  Speaking to the court, McGivern said he saw Heard throw a can of Red Bull at Depp before she spat on him and punched him with a closed first in the face.  Mr McGivern said under oath: "On 23 March 2015, I was working a security shift at Mr Depp’s residence where Mr Depp was also staying at the time.  "At some time between 4 am to 6 am, Mr Depp contacted me and asked me to come to Penthouse 5, which is the penthouse he owns in the building adjacent to his principal home in Penthouse 3. He also asked me to bring a nurse who works for Mr Depp called Debbie Lloyd.  "I do not recall him specifying why he wanted Nurse Lloyd to come.  "When Ms Lloyd and I entered his residence, Ms Heard and Mr Depp were having a verbal argument. Ms Heard's sister was also present. I cannot recall the specifics of what was being said but there was a lot of shouting mixed in with some moments of calmer communication. This argument lasted approximately 60 to 90 minutes."  After claiming the argument got "louder and more intense," McGivern said he entered the room and after around 30 minutes Ms Heard threw a can of Red Bull.  McGivern continued: "After Ms Heard threw the can of Red Bull, I recognized that Ms Heard had access to a variety of other items that she could throw from her position. I therefore moved next to Mr Depp to ensure that he would not get hit by anything else.
